comment.body:
I tried disabling AdGuard while keeping Safari's content blockers on, and the player works fine with ads showing. However, when I enable AdGuard and disable it for the [site](https://ddys.pro) (allow list), the player fails to load and the ads are blocked. I guess the problem might not be with Safari's content blockers. Perhaps updating your rules could fix the issue?

| AdGuard Client       | Safari Content Blockers | Player           | Ads     |
| -------------------- | ----------------------- | ---------------- | ------- |
| off                  | on                      | loads successful | appears |
| on(disable for site) | on                      | loads failed     | blocked |

![X战警97 (更新至10) - 低端影视 3](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/20644119/5a15a282-3b35-44d0-bd0c-fbc5d6c328b9)

comment.body:
I tested each of the seven rules I enabled one by one. When either the [AdGuard Chinese filter](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/FiltersRegistry/tree/master/filters/filter_224_Chinese) or [EasyList China](https://github.com/easylist/easylistchina) is enabled, the player fails to load.
In the [documentation page](https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/adguard-filters/), I see that the AdGuard Chinese filter is based on EasyList China. However, these two rules themselves should be fine. I enabled these two rules in the AdGuard Chrome extension, and the video player can load normally.

comment.body:
AdGuard Chrome extension supports the most of rule types. 
AdGuard for iOS does not support many rules, especially free version - it can't apply advanced rules.

I see only one blocked request on desktop, and few hidden banners.
Please add to user rules and check again (also wait after adding)

```
@@||static.cloudflareinsights.com^$domain=ddys.pro
ddys.pro#@#.cfa_popup
ddys.pro#@#.post-title + .metadata + .entry > div > div > a[href^="/"][href$="/"] > img
```

comment.body:
> When using Adguard on iPad, ads on YouTube aren’t blocked properly like on the Mac. Instead of showing no ads at all, a black loading screen is being displayed instead of the ad, meaning you are still required to watch 15 seconds of black screen.

Hm. Looks like these rules are not applied

```
youtube.com#%#//scriptlet('json-prune-xhr-response', 'playerResponse.adPlacements playerResponse.playerAds playerResponse.adSlots adPlacements playerAds adSlots', '', '/playlist\?list=|player\?|watch\?v=/')
youtube.com#%#//scriptlet('json-prune-fetch-response', 'playerResponse.adPlacements playerResponse.playerAds playerResponse.adSlots adPlacements playerAds adSlots', '', '/playlist\?list=|player\?|watch\?v=/')
```
But they are exist in https://filters.adtidy.org/ios/filters/2_optimized.txt

I can reproduce when switching to the next video.
@AdamWr @piquark6046 Could you please take a look? Not an AG for iOS bug?
